regulatory body see FIBA International governing body association football FIFA F d ration Internationale de Football Association Logo FIFA Map members FIFA according confederation Abbreviation FIFA Motto Game World Founded May years ago Founded at Paris France Type Sports federation Legal status Governing body association football Purpose Sport governance Headquarters Z rich Switzerland Coordinates N E N E Coordinates N E N E Region served Worldwide Membership national associations Official languages English French German Spanish President Gianni Infantino Senior Vice President Salman bin Ibrahim Al Khalifa AFC Vice Presidents Aleksander eferin UEFA Greg Clarke Alejandro Dom nguez CONMEBOL Ahmad Ahmad CAF Victor Montagliani CONCACAF S ndor Cs nyi Lambert Maltock OFC Secretary General Fatma Samoura Main organ Congress Subsidiaries AFC CAF CONCACAF CONMEBOL OFC UEFA Affiliations International Olympic Committee International Football Association Board Staff Website www fifa com F d ration Internationale de Football Association FIFA fi f FEE f French International Federation Association Football Spanish Federaci n Internacional de F tbol Asociaci n German Internationaler Verband des Association Football non profit organization which describes itself as an international governing body association football f tsal beach soccer efootball It highest governing body football FIFA was founded in oversee international competition among national associations Belgium Denmark France Germany Netherlands Spain Sweden Switzerland Headquartered in Z rich its membership now comprises national associations Member countries must each also be members one six regional confederations into which world divided Africa Asia Europe North Central America Caribbean Oceania South America Today FIFA outlines number objectives in organizational Statues including growing football internationally providing efforts ensure football accessible everyone advocating integrity fair play FIFA responsible organization promotion football s major international tournaments notably World Cup which commenced in Women s World Cup which commenced in Although FIFA does not solely set rules football that being responsibility International Football Association Board which FIFA member it applies enforces rules across all FIFA competitions All FIFA tournaments generate revenue from sponsorship in FIFA had revenues over US billion ending cycle with net positive US billion had cash reserves over US billion Reports by investigative journalists have linked FIFA leadership with corruption bribery vote rigging related election FIFA president Sepp Blatter organization s decision award World Cups Russia Qatar respectively These allegations led indictments nine high ranking FIFA officials five corporate executives by U S Department Justice on charges including racketeering wire fraud money laundering On May several these officials were arrested by Swiss authorities were launching simultaneous but separate criminal investigation into organization awarded World Cups Those among these officials were also indicted in U S are expected be extradited face charges as well Many officials were suspended by FIFA s ethics committee including Sepp Blatter Michel Platini In early reports became public about FIFA president Gianni Infantino attempting prevent re elections both chairmen ethics committee Cornel Borb ly Hans Joachim Eckert during FIFA congress in May On May following Infantino s proposal FIFA Council decided not renew mandates Borb ly Eckert Together with chairmen committee members were removed Contents History Structure Laws governance Administrative cost Six confederations national associations Governance Discipline national associations Video replay goal line technology Flag Anthem Recognitions awards FIFA competitions National teams Clubs eSports Former Tournaments Title holders Corruption Guilty pleas Indictments arrests World Cup bids FIFA presidential election Response allegations revision code ethics Presidency Sponsors See also Notes References Further reading External links History edit Main article History FIFA need single body oversee association football became apparent at beginning th century with increasing popularity international fixtures F d ration Internationale de Football Association FIFA was founded in rear headquarters Union des Soci t s Fran aises de Sports Athl tiques USFSA at Rue Saint Honor in Paris on May French name acronym are used even outside French speaking countries founding members were national associations Belgium Denmark France Netherlands Spain represented by then Madrid Football Club Royal Spanish Football Federation was not created until Sweden Switzerland Also that same day German Football Association DFB declared its intention affiliating through telegram first president FIFA was Robert Gu rin Gu rin was replaced in by Daniel Burley Woolfall from England by then member association first tournament FIFA staged association football competition Olympics in London was more successful than its Olympic predecessors despite presence professional footballers contrary founding principles FIFA dubious discuss Membership FIFA expanded beyond Europe with application South Africa in Argentina in Canada Chile in United States in During World War with many players sent off war possibility travel international fixtures severely limited organization s survival was in doubt Post war following death Woolfall organisation was run by Dutchman Carl Hirschmann It was saved from extinction but at cost withdrawal Home Nations United Kingdom cited an unwillingness participate in international competitions with recent World War enemies Home Nations later resumed membership FIFA collection held by National Football Museum at Urbis in Manchester England first World Cup was held in in Montevideo Uruguay Structure edit Main article List FIFA Member Associations Laws governance edit FIFA headquartered in Z rich an association established under law Switzerland FIFA s supreme body FIFA Congress an assembly made up representatives from each affiliated member association Each national football association has one vote regardless its size footballing strength Congress assembles in ordinary session once every year extraordinary sessions have been held once year since Congress makes decisions relating FIFA s governing statutes method implementation application Only Congress can pass changes FIFA s statutes congress approves annual report decides on acceptance new national associations holds elections Congress elects President FIFA its general secretary other members FIFA Council in year following FIFA World Cup FIFA Council formerly called FIFA Executive Committee chaired by president main decision making body organisation in intervals congress council composed people president vice presidents members from confederations with at least one them being woman Executive Committee body that decides which country will host World Cup president general secretary are main office holders FIFA are in charge its daily administration carried out by general secretariat with its staff approximately members Gianni Infantino current president elected on February at an extraordinary FIFA Congress session after former president Sepp Blatter was suspended pending corruption investigation FIFA s worldwide organizational structure also consists several other bodies under authority FIFA Council created by Congress as standing committees Among those bodies are FIFA Emergency Committee FIFA Ethics Committee Finance Committee Disciplinary Committee Referees Committee FIFA Emergency Committee deals with all matters requiring immediate settlement in time frame between regular meetings FIFA Council Emergency Committee consists FIFA president as well as one member from each confederation Emergency Committee decisions made are immediately put into legal effect although they need be ratified at next Executive Committee meeting Administrative cost edit FIFA publishes its results according IFRS total compensation management committee in was million people Blatter only full time person on committee earned approximately two million Swiss francs million in salary rest in bonuses report in London s Sunday Times in June said members committee had salaries doubled from during year report also said leaked documents had indicated million in secret bonuses had been paid committee members following FIFA World Cup in South Africa Six confederations national associations edit FIFA confederations AFC CAF CONCACAF CONMEBOL OFC UEFA v t e Besides its worldwide institutions are six confederations recognized by FIFA which oversee game in different continents regions world National associations not continental confederations are members FIFA continental confederations are provided in FIFA s statutes membership confederation prerequisite FIFA membership Asian Football Confederation AFC members b Confederation African Football CAF members Confederation North Central American Caribbean Association Football CONCACAF members c Confederaci n Sudamericana de F tbol CONMEBOL members Oceania Football Confederation OFC members b Union European Football Associations UEFA members d In total FIFA recognizes national associations associated men s national teams as well as women s national teams see list national football teams respective country codes FIFA has more member states than UN as FIFA recognises non sovereign entities as distinct nations such as four Home Nations within United Kingdom politically disputed territories such as Palestine FIFA Working Committee Small Nations has categorized potential FIFA members into three categories Independent states not in FIFA Kiribati Marshall Islands Micronesia Monaco Niue Palau Tuvalu Vatican City Non independent territories land Islands Guadeloupe Greenland Guernsey Isle Man Jersey Martinique Northern Mariana Islands R union Sint Maarten Zanzibar Politically sensitive areas Abkhazia Crimea Northern Cyprus South Ossetia FIFA World Rankings are updated monthly rank each team based on performance in international competitions qualifiers friendly matches also world ranking women s football updated four times year Governance edit This section needs additional citations verification Please help improve this article by adding citations reliable sources Unsourced material may be challenged removed Find sources FIFA news newspapers books scholar JSTOR May Learn remove this template message Main article Laws Game association football FIFA headquarters in Z rich laws that govern football known officially as Laws Game are not solely responsibility FIFA they are maintained by body called International Football Association Board IFAB FIFA has members on its board four representatives other four are provided by football associations United Kingdom England Scotland Wales Northern Ireland jointly established IFAB in are recognised creation history game Changes Laws Game must be agreed by at least six eight delegates FIFA Statutes form overarching document guiding FIFA s governing system governing system divided into separate bodies that have appropriate powers create system checks balances It consists four general bodies congress executive committee general secretariat standing ad hoc committees Discipline national associations edit FIFA frequently takes active roles in running sport developing game around world One its sanctions suspend teams associated members from international competition government interferes in running FIFA s associate member organisations if associate not functioning properly FIFA ruling that player can be registered with maximum three clubs appear in official matches maximum two in year measured from July June has led controversy especially in those countries whose seasons cross that date barrier as in case two former Ireland internationals As direct result this controversy FIFA modified this ruling following year accommodate transfers between leagues with out phase seasons Video replay goal line technology edit See also Goal line technology Video assistant referee FIFA now permits use video evidence during matches as well as subsequent sanctions However most FIFA s history it stood opposed its use meeting International Football Association Board agreed request television authorities refrain from any slow motion play back which reflected might reflect adversely on any decision referee As recently as FIFA president Sepp Blatter said Let it be as it let s leave football with errors television companies will have right say referee was right wrong but still referee makes decision man not machine This stance was finally overturned on March IFAB wrote video assistant referees also known as VARs into Laws Game on permanent basis use remains optional competitions In early July FIFA sanctioned use goal line technology subject rules specified by International Football Association Board IFAB had officially approved its use by amending Laws Game permit but not require its use This followed high profile incident during second round game in FIFA World Cup between England Germany shot by Englishman Frank Lampard which would have levelled scores at in match that ultimately ended in German victory crossed line but was not seen do so by match officials which led FIFA officials declare that they would re examine use goal line technology Flag edit F d ration Internationale de Football Association Use Sport Proportion Adopted FIFA flag has blue background with organisation s logo in middle current FIFA flag was first flown during FIFA World Cup opening ceremony in Moscow Russia Anthem edit Main article FIFA Anthem Akin UEFA Champions League FIFA has adopted an anthem composed by German composer Franz Lambert since FIFA World Cup It has been re arranged produced by Rob May Simon Hill FIFA Anthem played at beginning official FIFA sanctioned matches tournaments such as international friendlies FIFA World Cup FIFA Women s World Cup FIFA U World Cup FIFA U World Cup Football at Summer Olympics FIFA U Women s World Cup FIFA Women s U World Cup FIFA Futsal World Cup FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup FIFA Club World Cup Since FIFA has also required most its broadcast partners use short sequences including anthem at beginning end FIFA event coverage as well as break bumpers help promote FIFA s sponsors This emulates practices long used by some other international football events such as UEFA Champions League Exceptions may be made specific events example an original piece African music was used bumpers during FIFA World Cup Recognitions awards edit FIFA holds an annual awards ceremony Best FIFA Football Awards since which recognises both individual team achievements in international association football Individually top men s player awarded Best FIFA Men s Player top women s player Best FIFA Women s Player Another main awards are Best FIFA Football Coach FIFA FIFPro World In FIFA presented two awards FIFA Club Century FIFA Player Century decide greatest football club player th century Real Madrid was club winner while Diego Maradona Pel were joint players winners FIFA competitions edit National teams edit Men s FIFA World Cup Men s Olympic Football Tournament U FIFA U World Cup FIFA U World Cup Boys Youth Olympic Football Tournament U FIFA Futsal World Cup FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup Women s FIFA Women s World Cup Women s Olympic Football Tournament FIFA U Women s World Cup FIFA U Women s World Cup Girls Youth Olympic Football Tournament U Clubs edit Men s FIFA Club World Cup FIFA Youth Cup Women s FIFA Women s Club World Cup proposed eSports edit Individual FIFA eWorld Cup Former Tournaments edit FIFA Confederations Cup Title holders edit Hosts all Senior Association Football FIFA World Cups including both men s women s Current National Teams Competition Men s Women s World Cup France United States Olympic Tournament Brazil Germany U World Cup Ukraine Japan U World Cup Brazil Spain Youth Olympic Football Tournament Peru China PR Youth Olympic Futsal Tournament Brazil Portugal Futsal World Cup Argentina Beach Soccer World Cup Brazil eNations Cup France Clubs Competition Men s Women s Blue Stars FIFA Youth Cup Boca Juniors Wolfsburg Club World Cup Real Madrid Individuals Competition Player eWorld Cup Mohammed Harkous Last after competition abolished National Teams Competition Men s Confederations Cup Germany Corruption edit Main article FIFA corruption case In May British investigative reporter Andrew Jennings book Foul Secret World FIFA Bribes Vote Rigging Ticket Scandals Harper Collins caused controversy within football world by detailing an alleged international cash contracts scandal following collapse FIFA s marketing partner International Sport Leisure ISL revealed some football officials have been urged secretly repay sweeteners they received book also alleged that vote rigging had occurred in fight Sepp Blatter s continued control FIFA as organization s president Shortly after release Foul BBC Panorama expos by Jennings BBC producer Roger Corke screened on June reported that Blatter was being investigated by Swiss police over his role in secret deal repay more than m worth bribes pocketed by football officials Lord Triesman former chairman English Football Association described FIFA as an organization that behaves like mafia family highlighting organization s decades long traditions bribes bungs corruption All testimonies offered in Panorama expos were provided through disguised voice appearance both save one Mel Brennan former CONCACAF official became first high level football insider go public with substantial allegations corruption nonfeasance malfeasance by CONCACAF FIFA leadership Brennan highest level African American in history world football governance joined Jennings Trinidadian journalist Lisana Liburd many others in exposing allegedly inappropriate allocations money by CONCACAF drew connections between ostensible CONCACAF criminality similar behaviors at FIFA Since then in light fresh allegations corruption by FIFA in late both Jennings Brennan remain highly critical FIFA has Brennan called directly an alternative FIFA be considered by stakeholders sport throughout world In further Panorama expos broadcast on November Jennings alleged that three senior FIFA officials Nicolas Leoz Issa Hayatou Ricardo Teixeira had been paid huge bribes by ISL between which FIFA had failed investigate Jennings claimed they appeared on list bribes paid by ISL totaling about million former ISL executive said that were suspicions within company that they were only awarded marketing contract successive World Cups by paying bribes FIFA officials programme also alleged that another current official Jack Warner has been repeatedly involved in reselling World Cup tickets touts Blatter said that FIFA had not investigated allegation it had not been told about it via official channels Panorama also alleged that FIFA requires nations bidding host World Cup agree implement special laws including blanket tax exemption FIFA its corporate sponsors limitation workers rights Contrary FIFA s demands these conditions were revealed by Dutch government resulting in them being told by FIFA that bid could be adversely affected Following Jennings earlier investigations he was banned from all FIFA press conferences reasons he claimed had not been made clear accused officials failed answer questions about his latest allegations either verbally by letter Prime Minister David Cameron Andy Anson head England s World Cup bid criticized timing broadcast three days before FIFA s decision on host FIFA World Cup on grounds that it might damage England s bid voters included officials accused by programme In June it came light that International Olympic Committee had started inquiry proceedings against FIFA honorary president Jo o Havelange into claims bribery Panorama alleged that Havelange accepted million bung in from ISL IOC stated that it takes all allegations corruption very seriously we would always ask any evidence wrongdoing involving any IOC members be passed our ethics commission In interview American sports writer Dave Zirin said that corruption endemic FIFA leadership that organization should be abolished good game He said that currently FIFA in charge both monitoring corruption in football matches marketing selling sport but that two separate organizational bodies are needed an organizational body that monitors corruption match fixing like an organization that s responsible marketing sponsorships selling sport Zirin said idea having single organization that s responsible both seems highly ineffective detrimental sport In May people were arrested including nine FIFA officials after being accused corruption Guilty pleas edit Between four individuals two sports television rights corporations pleaded guilty United States financial misconduct charges pleas Chuck Blazer Jos Hawilla Daryan Warner Darrell Warner Traffic Group Traffic Sports USA were unsealed in May In another case Singapore also imposed year harshest sentence ever received match fixing on match fixer Eric Ding had bribed three Lebanese FIFA football officials with prostitutes as an inducement fix future matches that they would officiate as well as perverting course justice Indictments arrests edit Fourteen FIFA officials marketing executives were indicted by United States Department Justice in May officials were arrested in Switzerland are in process extradition US Specific charges brought under RICO act include wire fraud racketeering money laundering Swiss authorities say they have also opened separate criminal investigation into FIFA s operations pertaining World Cup bids FIFA s top officials were arrested at hotel in Switzerland on suspicion receiving bribes totaling m m US Department Justice stated that nine FIFA officials four executives sports management companies were arrested accused over m in bribes UK Shadow Home Secretary Labour Member Parliament Andy Burnham stated in May that England should boycott World Cup against corruption in FIFA military aggression by Russia World Cup bids edit Further information FIFA World Cup bids Garcia Report FIFA s choice award World Cup Russia World Cup Qatar has been widely criticised by media It has been alleged that some FIFA inside sources insist that Russian kickbacks cash gifts given FIFA executive members were enough secure Russian bid weeks before result was announced Sepp Blatter was widely criticised in media giving warning about evils media in speech FIFA executive committee members shortly before they voted on hosting World Cup reference Sunday Times expos s Panorama investigation Two members FIFA s executive committee were banned from all football related activity in November allegedly offering sell votes undercover newspaper reporters In early May British parliamentary inquiry into England failed secure finals was told by member parliament Damian Collins that was evidence from Sunday Times newspaper that Issa Hayatou Cameroon Jacques Anouma Ivory Coast were paid by Qatar Qatar has categorically denied allegations as have Hayatou Anouma FIFA president Blatter said as May update that British newspaper Sunday Times has agreed bring its whistle blowing source meet senior FIFA officials will decide whether order new investigation into alleged World Cup bidding corruption Sunday Times are happy they agreed that they will bring this whistleblower here Z rich then we will have discussion an investigation this Blatter said Specifically whistleblower claims that FIFA executive committee members Issa Hayatou Jacques Anouma were paid million vote Qatar emirate s bid beat United States in final round voting last December Blatter did not rule out reopening vote if corruption could be proved but urged taking matter step by step FIFA president said his organization anxiously awaiting more evidence before asking its ethics committee examine allegations made in Britain s Parliament in early May Hayatou from Cameroon leads Confederation African Football FIFA vice president Anouma president Ivorian Football Federation whistleblower said Qatar agreed pay third African voter Amos Adamu his support Nigerian was later suspended from voting after FIFA ethics court ruled he solicited bribes from undercover Sunday Times reporters posing as lobbyists Blatter said newspaper its whistleblower would meet with FIFA secretary general J r me Valcke legal director Marco Villiger Allegations against FIFA officials have also been made UK Parliament by David Triesman former head England s bid English Football Association Triesman told lawmakers that four long standing FIFA executive committee members Jack Warner Nicol s Leoz Ricardo Teixeira Worawi Makudi engaged in improper unethical conduct in bidding which was won by Russia All six FIFA voters have denied wrongdoing On September Sepp Blatter suggested that World Cup being awarded Russia was planned before voting that World Cup would have then been awarded United States However this plan changed after election ballot World Cup was awarded Qatar instead U S According leaked documents seen by Sunday Times Qatari state run television channel Al Jazeera secretly offered million FIFA broadcasting rights just days before FIFA announced that Qatar will hold World Cup contract also documented secret TV deal between FIFA Qatar s state run media broadcast Al Jazeera that million will also be paid into designated FIFA account only if Qatar wins World Cup ballot in An additional million was also offered by State Qatar government three years after initial offer which brings amount million offered by Qatar host world cup documents are now part bribery inquiry by Swiss Police FIFA refused comment on inquiry responded Sunday Times in an email wrote allegations linked Fifa World Cup bid have already been extensively commented by Fifa in June published Garcia report in full on Fifa com Furthermore please note that Fifa lodged criminal complaint with Office Attorney General Switzerland which still pending Fifa will continue cooperate with authorities Damian Collins called payments from Al Jazeera be frozen launch an investigation into apparent contract since contract appears be in clear breach rules FIFA presidential election edit FIFA announced on May that it had opened investigation examine conduct four officials Mohamed Bin Hammam Jack Warner along with Caribbean Football Union CFU officials Debbie Minguell Jason Sylvester in relation claims made by executive committee member Chuck Blazer Blazer was at time general secretary CONCACAF confederation has alleged that violations were committed under FIFA code ethics during meeting organized by Bin Hammam Warner on May same time Lord Triesman had accused Warner demanding money World Cup vote in relation FIFA presidential election in which Bin Hammam also played key role in Qatar FIFA World Cup bid allegedly offered financial incentives votes cast in his favour during presidential election As result investigation both Bin Hammam Warner were suspended Warner reacted his suspension by questioning Blatter s conduct adding that FIFA secretary general J r me Valcke had told him via e mail that Qatar had bought World Cup Valcke subsequently issued statement denying he had suggested it was bribery saying instead that country had used its financial muscle lobby support Qatar officials denied any impropriety Bin Hammam also responded by writing FIFA protesting unfair treatment in suspension by FIFA Ethics Committee FIFA administration Further evidence emerged alleged corruption On May Fred Lunn vice president Bahamas Football Association said that he was given in cash as an incitement vote FIFA presidential candidate Mohamed bin Hammam In addition on June Louis Giskus president Surinamese Football Association alleged that he was given in cash development projects as an incentive vote Bin Hammam Response allegations edit After being re elected as president FIFA Sepp Blatter responded allegations by promising reform FIFA in wake bribery scandal with Danny Jordaan CEO FIFA World Cup in South Africa saying great expectation reform Former US Secretary State Henry Kissinger being tipped role on newly proposed Solutions Committee former Netherlands national football team player Johan Cruyff also being linked with role UEFA secretary general Gianni Infantino said he hopes concrete measures be taken by world game s authority Saying that UEFA executive committee has taken note will FIFA take concrete effective measures good governance following situation closely IOC president Jacques Rogge commented on situation by saying that he believes FIFA can emerge stronger from its worst ever crisis stating that will not point finger lecture am sure FIFA can emerge stronger from within Several FIFA s partners sponsors have raised concerns about allegations corruption including Coca Cola Adidas Emirates Visa Coca Cola raised concerns by saying current allegations being raised are distressing bad sport with Adidas saying negative tenor public debate around Fifa at moment neither good football nor Fifa its partners moreover Emirates raised its concerns by saying we hope that these issues will be resolved as soon as possible Visa adding current situation clearly not good game we ask that Fifa take all necessary steps resolve concerns that have been raised Australian Sports Minister Mark Arbib said it was clear FIFA needed change saying no doubt needs be reform FIFA This something that we re hearing worldwide with Australian Senator Nick Xenophon accusing FIFA scamming country out million US million it spent on Australia FIFA World Cup bid saying that until investigation into FIFA has been completed Australia must hold off spending any more taxpayers money on any future World Cup bids Theo Zwanziger president German Football Association also called on FIFA re examine awarding World Cup Qatar Transparency International which had called on FIFA postpone election pending full independent investigation renewed its call on FIFA change its governance structure Moreover former Argentine football player Diego Maradona was critical FIFA in light corruption scandal comparing members board dinosaurs He said Fifa big museum They are dinosaurs do not want relinquish power It s always going be same In October Dick Pound criticized organization saying FIFA has fallen far short credible demonstration that it recognizes many problems it faces that it has will solve them that it willing be transparent about it doing it finds that its conduct in future will be such that public can be confident in governance sport revision code ethics edit In FIFA revised its code ethics remove corruption as one enumerated bases ethical violations It retained bribery misappropriation funds manipulation competitions as offenses but added statute limitation clause that those offenses could not be pursued after ten year period revision also made it an offence make public statements defamatory nature against FIFA Alexandra Wrage former member FIFA governance committee an expert in anti bribery compliance said that revision that real value FIFA chilling effect this will have on critics Presidency edit Main article List presidents FIFA Presidents FIFA No Name Country origin Took office Left office Note Robert Gu rin France May June Daniel Burley Woolfall United Kingdom June October Died in office Cornelis August Wilhelm Hirschman Netherlands October Acting Jules Rimet France March June Rodolphe Seeldrayers Belgium June October Died in office Arthur Drewry United Kingdom June March Died in office Ernst Thommen Switzerland March September Acting Stanley Rous United Kingdom September May Jo o Havelange Brazil May June Sepp Blatter Switzerland June October Impeached Issa Hayatou Cameroon October February Acting Gianni Infantino Italy Switzerland February Incumbent Sponsors edit Adidas Coca Cola Guiana Guyana Suriname are CONCACAF members although they are in South America French Guiana team member CONCACAF but not FIFA Teams representing nations Armenia Azerbaijan Cyprus Georgia Israel Kazakhstan Russia Turkey are UEFA members although majority entirety territory outside continental Europe Monaco not member UEFA FIFA References edit b F d ration Internationale de Football
